programme.title: Grace
programme.desc: Rising music star Gaia Lafayette announces to her devoted fans that she and her band are headed to Los Angeles, but a shocking attack leads Grace and Branson to believe someone may be trying to harm her. Crime drama, starring John Simm

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team share their favourite money-saving gardening tips, creating classic garden features that are big on impact and easy on the pocket. With the average cost of a full garden makeover now believed to be between seven and ten thousand pounds, Katie Rushworth and David Domoney come to the aid of two families of garden novices, who only half that amount to spend. Taking totally different approaches and encouraging the garden owners to get stuck in, they will try and help them build their dream garden without going over the three and half thousand-pound budget. Will the owners be impressed by the money saving makeovers?

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Sisters Oti and Motsi Mabuse head on a journey across their homeland of South Africa to explore their extraordinary family history. The sisters have tried to explore their history before, but with records for black South Africans almost non-existent, going on their DNA journey is the last roll of the dice to discover their roots. Beginning their journey just north of Johannesburg, the sisters are delighted to connect with their cousin Samantha, who reveals their familial link to an African Royal family. Later, the pair trace other branches of their family line and discover a brave ancestor who fought in World War Two, before finding out they are also related to the famous South African musician, Hotstix Mabuse

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott demonstrates recipes featuring nuts, making a breakfast dish of ricotta pancakes with bananas, pecans and maple syrup, while Paul A Young meets a coffee roaster to learn about the complex flavours. Former gymnast Louis Smith uses pine nuts in his prawn and pesto zesty lemon linguine, before Ainsley knocks up chicken satay skewers with pickled cucumber salad

programme.title: Dare Master @Home
programme.desc: A challenge involving baked beans and chopsticks and one in which the competitors have 30 seconds to get 150 steps on a pedometer

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd becomes trapped in the web of Petrichor, a very hungry spider - fortunately, Petrichor is also very chatty, and so Lloyd must rely on his wits to try and talk his way out of their web - or, at least, buy some time so he can be rescued...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. The newsstand has a new comic in stock called Llerd the Fly, and Lloyd is appalled to discover that Llerd is based on him! Intent on preventing any more copies of Llerd being produced, Lloyd sets out to uncover the identity of the comic's mysterious author.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: International Rescue are dispatched to save one of their own when the Hood traps Lady Penelope and Parker inside an underwater hyper-train loop during a high-stakes robbery. Updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, with the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak, Thomas Brodie-Sangster and David Graham

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Pigsy accidentally replaces the Monkey Mech game at his restaurant with ping-pong and gets wildly addicted, so Monkie Kid has to break Pigsy out of his addiction using the Monkey King's training blindfold that only comes off when he listens to others. Meanwhile, MK opens a cage filled with fruit babies - when they run amok and cause havoc, Mo has to find a way to stop them.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Speedy Panda stores have appeared everywhere - along with their biker gang delivery boys - and they are messing Monkie Kid's deliveries up and sabotaging Pigsy's restaurant. Things boil over until a food war is declared between them - MK and Pigsy go into hand-to-hand combat in food preparation against the Speedy Panda owners, who just happen to be Jin and Yin...

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: CGI-animated update of the classic children's cartoon from the 1980s. Inspector Gadget becomes a walking bomb after eating a chilli pepper and Penny must keep him from detonating

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: CGI-animated update of the classic children's cartoon from the 1980s. Penny sneaks into a MAD training seminar and Inspector Gadget ends up in an anger management seminar

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. If the friends want to be cool this time, they're going to have to see the latest series of the hip programme River Things, but in order to see it, they'll need to subscribe to NET TV. After a few mishaps, they wind up at Miss Birdwhistle's house... where they all fall asleep in front of the TV. What a bizarre series of events!

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Our heroes notice that all the coolest dudes are always surrounded by girls, so they decide to go looking for a girl who wants to hang out with them - after encountering several refusals, Simone finally accepts! However, Simone is no pushover, and through her daring and cunning actions, she teaches the boys a lesson about their macho prejudices by hugely exaggerating all the cliches they have about girls.

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef's culinary tour of France leads him to the diverse and distinct region of the Camargue, a natural region located south of Arles. James begins at Les Marquises, the Laurent family's farm, where he learns about the Camargue bull, and barbecues local fish for the family. Later, he visits a rice farm and cooks a risotto using his own rice-brewed beer

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Sisters Oti and Motsi Mabuse head on a journey across their homeland of South Africa to explore their extraordinary family history. The sisters have tried to explore their history before, but with records for black South Africans almost non-existent, going on their DNA journey is the last roll of the dice to discover their roots. Beginning their journey just north of Johannesburg, the sisters are delighted to connect with their cousin Samantha, who reveals their familial link to an African Royal family. Later, the pair trace other branches of their family line and discover a brave ancestor who fought in World War Two, before finding out they are also related to the famous South African musician, Hotstix Mabuse

programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate when the body of a woman is pulled from the river during the local Oak Apple carnival. Closer inspection suggests the drowning was deliberate - and, as the detectives find out more about the villagers, they learn the killing could be linked to the death of the victim's daughter eight years previously. John Nettles and Jason Hughes play the intrepid policemen, with guest star Simon Callow

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate the apparent suicide of a solicitor rumoured to have been stealing money from clients. When rival lawyer Otto Benham is later found murdered in a bizarre manner, the detectives begin to suspect the two deaths may be related. Mystery, starring John Nettles, John Hopkins, Barry Jackson, James Weber Brown and Oliver Ford Davies

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The naked body of a business executive is found dumped in a rival factory's steriliser machine, leaving Barnaby and Scott with a complicated mystery to unravel. Their investigation begins with factory owners the Plummers, who seem to be hiding more than their share of secrets. Detective drama, starring John Nettles, John Hopkins, Annette Crosbie and Jasper Britton

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The discovery of a priceless music score leads to startling revelations about its composer's life. As Barnaby and Scott investigate, they discover the manuscript may also provide them with the clue they need to solve the case of a local man found battered to death in his cottage. Guest starring June Whitfield and Trevor Peacock

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A house-hunting couple are found dead shortly after viewing a supposedly haunted cottage. Locals claim the property is cursed - but Barnaby and Jones soon hear enough to suspect several builders, developers and estate agents of resorting to murder. John Nettles and Jason Hughes star, with George Baker, Ruth Gemmell and Jane Wymark

programme.title: Snooker: Tour Championship Live
programme.desc: Coverage of day six, featuring the concluding session of the second semi-final, held at Bonus Arena in Hull. Eventual champion Neil Robertson edged past Ronnie O'Sullivan 10-9 in a high-scoring affair at this stage last year, with 'The Rocket' going out despite becoming the first player ever to make five century breaks in two consecutive matches. Jill Douglas presents, with analysis from Stephen Hendry, Alan McManus, Ken Doherty, Neal Foulds, and commentary by Phil Yates and David Hendon

programme.title: The Booze Cruise II: The Treasure Hunt (2005)
programme.desc: Dave, Rob and Maurice embark on a two-day charity treasure hunt. They're joined by Dave's wife Cath, keen to make sure her husband sticks to his diet, Daniel, who's back from France and worrying he may not be the father of his pregnant wife's baby, and Marcus Forster, a potential client of Dave, who's not exactly the most pleasant fellow they've ever met. The only trouble is, everyone has to be nice to him if Dave's going to bag a new contract. Comedy drama sequel, starring Mark Benton

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: The flatmates crave a bit of summer warmth, and Mrs Roper's sunlamp mysteriously disappears. Comedy, with Richard O'Sullivan

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Chrissy and Jo are entranced when they meet Robin's older brother. Comedy, with Richard O'Sullivan

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Part two of two. Despite arresting four people, the detectives face a wall of silence in their investigation into the grisly murders - but they eventually make a breakthrough, which doesn't quite give them the answers they were expecting. On the domestic front, Rachel wakes up in bed with charismatic colleague Sean - a mistake she is keen never to repeat - and Janet wants to keep her newly single status a secret

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Since calling off his marriage to Louisa, Martin has begun to question what keeps him in Cornwall and realises that if he is ever to escape, he must conquer the blood phobia that ended his surgical career. Encouraged by aunt Joan's friend Barbara he tackles his fear, but after an accident the pair end up in hospital, where he bumps into his girlfriend from medical school. Later, the return of a familiar face shakes him up even more. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes, Stephanie Cole and Lia Williams

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: An exciting offer for Edith divides opinion, Isobel throws Ethel a lifeline and Anna's perseverance finally pays off. Daisy is unhappy when Alfred takes a keen interest in newly arrived maid Ivy, while Matthew's concerns about the estate grow - but are his protests falling on deaf ears? Costume drama, starring Laura Carmichael, Penelope Wilton, Amy Nuttall, Joanne Froggatt and Dan Stevens

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Tempers fray as a kind gesture by Isobel backfires, while Mary fights Branson's corner when his decisions are put under scrutiny. Robert and Cora's relationship is under pressure, but can Violet make them see things differently? Bates goes to extreme lengths as his chance of freedom slips away. Costume drama, starring Penelope Wilton, Hugh Bonneville and Elizabeth McGovern

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: It's a happy day for Downton as Anna's patience is rewarded, while Edith receives admiration from an unexpected quarter. Matthew refuses to back down over the estate management, but will his tactics pay off? Branson's plan for the christening causes consternation, as does the arrival of his brother, and O'Brien's motives are unclear as she counsels Thomas. Julian Fellowes' period drama, starring Joanne Froggatt, Laura Carmichael, Dan Stevens and Allen Leech

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: There is excitement throughout the house and nearby village as the annual cricket match draws near, and the event brings out Robert's competitive side. Violet's great-niece Rose arrives, but a trip to London reveals there is more to her than meets the eye, while Matthew and Mary seem to be keeping secrets from each other. Thomas's future appears to be uncertain, but he may have found an unexpected ally in Bates

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: In the Christmas special from 2012, Robert and his family make their annual summer visit to his Scottish cousins at Duneagle Castle, leaving most of their servants at home. Edith discovers newspaper editor Michael Gregson is also on holiday in the area and may not be there just for the sketching and fishing, while personal servant O'Brien finds a kindred spirit below stairs in the form of her opposite number. Meanwhile, at Downton, Carson faces the task of keeping the staff focused on their work polishing the silverware and cleaning, but with the Granthams hundreds of miles away, minds begin to wander to other things, including the forthcoming Thirsk Country Fair

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis investigate the murder of a businesswoman connected with an organisation that supports gifted children, who had apparently been blackmailing the father of one particularly promising youngster. Further deaths follow, and as the body count rises, they realise there is a decades-old secret at the heart of the case. Matters are complicated still further by the presence in Oxford of former MI5 spymaster Grace Orde, who is visiting to sign copies of her tell-all memoir - which provides a vital clue to the killer's identity. Detective drama, guest starring Anna Chancellor and Cherie Lunghi, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help more people to reunite with long-lost relatives, following a woman on a quest to solve a family mystery and find her sisters, and a woman living with the heart-breaking decision to give up her son for adoption when she was just a teenager

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Unseen Adventures
programme.desc: The actress presents a final selection of previously unseen footage from her travelogue programmes, revealing unseen stories and special moments of how these journeys are made. This one follows her adventures in and around Iran, from where she followed the Silk Road through Azerbaijan and Georgia, finally moving on to Venice. The programme also presents behind the scenes footage from Joanna's travels in Haiti and Cuba, including previously unseen footage of her other adventures in the Caribbean

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A comatose surfer is washed ashore in what seems to have been a freak accident, until sinister facts emerge and Wycliffe is called in. It is not long before the team uncovers a conspiracy - but the case is hindered by a leak to the Press that threatens not only the investigation but also DI Lane's career. Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill star

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The Cornish detective's silver wedding celebrations are interrupted by a fresh outbreak of crime on his patch. Five dead bodies have been found on board an abandoned lorry at the ferry terminal and a fugitive is on the run. Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill star

programme.title: Ladies of Letters
programme.desc: Vera accepts an invitation to stay with Irene, but blots her copybook by upstaging her at the cricket club dance. Irene is driven to drink by the news her daughter Lesley is emigrating to Australia. Comedy, starring Anne Reid and Maureen Lipman

programme.title: Ladies of Letters
programme.desc: Vera learns her unmarried daughter Karen is pregnant and the youngster confides in her mother's pen pal about her brother Howard and his friend Anthony. programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs

programme.desc: Harriet Walter (Law & Order: UK) joins the cast as the costume drama returns. programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: In an earlier investigation, Jeremy Wade was propelled into an Indian river by a goonch catfish as big as himself, yet managed to land the rare beast after an epic battle. Ten years on, Jeremy hears a report from neighbouring Nepal of a mysterious attack that sounds strangely familiar - a lone fisherman on a mountain river dragged off his feet and into the water by an unseen creature. The extreme angler contemplates whether the original river monster could be back, and sets off to find out

programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. The newsstand has a new comic in stock called Llerd the Fly, and Lloyd is appalled to discover that Llerd is based on him! programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Pigsy accidentally replaces the Monkey Mech game at his restaurant with ping-pong and gets wildly addicted, so Monkie Kid has to break Pigsy out of his addiction using the Monkey King's training blindfold that only comes off when he listens to others. Meanwhile, MK opens a cage filled with fruit babies - when they run amok and cause havoc, Mo has to find a way to stop them.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Speedy Panda stores have appeared everywhere - along with their biker gang delivery boys - and they are messing Monkie Kid's deliveries up and sabotaging Pigsy's restaurant. Things boil over until a food war is declared between them - MK and Pigsy go into hand-to-hand combat in food preparation against the Speedy Panda owners, who just happen to be Jin and Yin...

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: CGI-animated update of the classic children's cartoon from the 1980s. Inspector Gadget becomes a walking bomb after eating a chilli pepper and Penny must keep him from detonating

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: CGI-animated update of the classic children's cartoon from the 1980s. Penny sneaks into a MAD training seminar and Inspector Gadget ends up in an anger management seminar

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. If the friends want to be cool this time, they're going to have to see the latest series of the hip programme River Things, but in order to see it, they'll need to subscribe to NET TV. After a few mishaps, they wind up at Miss Birdwhistle's house... where they all fall asleep in front of the TV. What a bizarre series of events!

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Our heroes notice that all the coolest dudes are always surrounded by girls, so they decide to go looking for a girl who wants to hang out with them - after encountering several refusals, Simone finally accepts! However, Simone is no pushover, and through her daring and cunning actions, she teaches the boys a lesson about their macho prejudices by hugely exaggerating all the cliches they have about girls.

programme.title: LEGO Marvel Avengers: Loki in Training
programme.desc: Animated short. When Iron Man and the Avengers launch a mission into the skies of New York City to save Nick Fury and the out-of-control Shield Helicarrier, they find themselves in a carefully laid trap by the cold and calculating Nebula... what's worse is that wherever Nebula is, Thanos can't be far behind! Will Loki continue his evil ways, or will he help his new teammates?

programme.title: What's New Scooby-Doo?
programme.desc: Cartoon capers with the mystery-solving canine and his friends

programme.title: What's New Scooby-Doo?
programme.desc: A cat-like creature is rumoured to be haunting the halls where a dog show is being held, so Scooby takes the gang to investigate

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam doesn't dare confess her futile passion for Booboocat - the cutest cat on the internet - but when she hears that he'll be passing through town, she decides to use the Spectral Sceptre to secretly get her idol into her home. Sam is so obsessed with Booboocat that she forgets about Roger...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Brick decides to launch the quest for the golden sock! It's a treasure hunt in the forest. The hunt is mapped out through riddles based on school lessons from that year. The first one to find the sock gets to choose where the next field trip will be! Since he hasn't studied, Mo decides to ask for the power to know everything the Internet knows. But with the half power, the scepter materialises the Internet under the form of a little boy and a little girl...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. City Hall set up a day for kids to pick up litter in the city. Noomi sees this as her chance to spend a romantic day with Mo. But Mo has one thing only on his mind: the top level in his video game! All he has to do is cross the bridge, fight the last duel and he'll win! But it's hopeless: every time, Mo botches this ultimate challenge. He requests the Scepter to grant him the power to enter his video game and cross the bridge for real!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam gets jealous when Stella starts spending more time with Janelle because they both love sports, and the invention of a new sport called 'Basket-Boing' threatens to overshadow their friendship. Convinced that she'll impress Stella and win back her attention by scoring baskets, Sam asks for the power of perfect aim - the only problem is that Sam and Mo's aim is off by ten centimetres at half-power! In order to wow Stella on the court, Sam is going to need Mo's help...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo tells Amber he agrees to help out in her parents' grocery store - he wants the Captain Responsible keyring on offer there. But it's a tedious job, long and repetitive. Mo asks the Scepter for the power to be super-fast! The trouble is - super-fast means super-messy. Worse, he soon discovers he has no control over his speed. He causes terrible damage, which has an unexpected effect on Amber. Mo has to find Sam, fix the grocery store - and fix Amber too!

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Cornea invites Lloyd and his family to dinner, but they can't stomach Cornea's unique cooking and adopt a series of bizarre ways to try and avoid eating the food without offending their host.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to compete with Berry and prove that he's 'more caring' by rescuing flies whether they want or need rescuing or not - however, his zealousness backfires when he attempts a daring rescue 'outside'!

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Sucked into the vacuum cleaner, Catastrophe Jim tries to convince Lloyd, Abacus and PB that they are now in the afterlife. Lloyd refuses to believe that a life as significant as his could be over so soon, so he sets out to prove that they're still alive.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd is cross when Berry brings his parents fruit fresh from the fridge - if anyone's going to raid the fridge, it should be him! Lloyd and Abacus therefore head to the fridge with Berry as their guide, but they find themselves unprepared for the cold...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to convince everyone that he's not afraid when they visit a spooky new attraction in the Backov Zofar. Nothing scares him - not even the 'ghost insects' who swoop out of the darkness - but when Abacus goes missing, Lloyd has to face his fears.

programme.title: How
programme.desc: More questions beginning with the word How. Join Vick Hope, Sam Homewood, and Frankie Vu as they discover how a car can scratch your back, are shown how to shake a sundae, and go large as Head of HOW Fred Dinenage challenges the team to big up the show.

programme.title: Drop Dead Weird
programme.desc: Bunni concludes that Maggie is a witch and organises a bogus event to expose her, but the tables are turned on Bunni soon she is branded as a witch

programme.title: Mr Magoo

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies

programme.title: LEGO Marvel Avengers: Loki in Training
programme.desc: Animated short. Thanos has arrived on Earth in search for his missing MECHfinity Gauntlet... and he's not happy. With the Avengers captured and held prisoner on the Shield Helicarrier, there's no-one left to stop him... except for Thor and Loki. Can the two brothers put their differences aside and come up with a plan to save the Avengers and Earth from Nebula and Thanos, or will they fail to work together as a team?

programme.title: What's New Scooby-Doo?
programme.desc: The canine detective and his gang become stranded in a ghost town with pop-punk band Simple Plan when their van is attacked by an invisible monster

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is desperate to join an Endangered Species Protection Association and asks the Scepter for the power to be really funny, so she can win the jury's attention during her online interview. But, the half power gives her a clown's appearance! A silly costume that's impossible to take off! When she goes to look for Mo, Sam is snapped up by Mr. Brick - who, it so happens, used to be a professional clown himself!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo is given endless hours of detention and he's in despair: will he ever have a free Wednesday afternoon again? Amber explains that he can cancel detention hours by doing good deeds for the school. But given his amount of detention, he'll have to perform civic actions that no one has ever managed to complete. To achieve all these tasks, Mo asks the Scepter to grant him ALL super powers.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. On her last test, Sam got an B+ instead of an A++, which lowers her grade average to a mere A. She loses sleep over this, has nightmares, and even forgets to perform her beloved Hammy's evening ritual - when Sam realises what a dreadful state she's in, her mind is made up to ask the Spectral Sceptre for the power to enter computers to alter her grade average in Mr Brick's computer. At half-power, Sam behaves like a computer virus - and infects her teacher's computer...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Brick wants a volunteer for a 'Nap Experiment' at school, a protocol which he hopes can improve his students' learning capacities. Mo volunteers, along with loads of other kids. Faced with so many volunteers, Brick proposes to choose the candidate via a lucky draw. Mo desperately wants to be chosen. He decides to favour his chances by asking the Scepter for the power of luck. But the half power means that he and Sam alternate between good luck... and bad luck.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. To retrieve his drone (which he thinks Hammy climbed onto by accident!), Mo requests the power to fly from the Scepter... and yes, he flies! But not the way he wants to: the half power has him drifting through the air like a helium balloon! As he floats above the rooftops on the end of a string held by Lenny, Younes and Owen see what they think is an Alien and launch an operation to capture him...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd and Abacus' friendship is tested when they find a chrysalis and can't agree on what to do with it - they think they have the answer when the chrysalis starts communicating with a series of knocks, but is it one knock for 'yes' or one knock for 'no'?

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Bob's best friend Gummy goes missing, Lloyd and Abacus take on the task of finding him... which is only right as they were the ones who lost him. Lloyd suspects foul play, so he compiles a list of suspects and starts following the clues.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies

Will the night impress the guests, and particularly the self-appointed Thai food expert at the table?

In the bar, competition talk turns tense and boiler troubles overnight pour cold water on the guests' stays.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

The B&Bers also get to the bottom of why one guest refused a return visit. After strong opinions are aired and differences debated, the payments are revealed and the winner is announced

programme.desc: Comedians James Acaster and Ed Gamble, Strictly dancer Katya Jones, Olympic snowboarder Aimee Fuller, actors Nicola Thorp and Nikesh Patel, mathematician Bobby Seagull, social media star Saffron Barker and TV therapists Nik and Eva Speakman go on the run across mainland UK while an elite team of police and military personnel try to track them down. The hunters being armed with the powers of the state - CCTV and ANPR cameras, drones, dogs, mobile phone tracking and social media publicity campaigns, means the celebrities have to be creative to evade capture. As the competitors escape from Shrewsbury prison and go on the run, the hunters are instantly on their tails, tracking them with CCTV cameras and a helicopter. All in aid of Stand Up To Cancer, James and Ed make a daring move with a six-course tasting menu at a Michelin guide restaurant while Nik and Eva escape on a tandem bike

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George gets to celebrate one of his favourite periods of British architecture when he helps out at an arts and crafts Edwardian terrace house in Addiscombe, south London. Cookie and Sophia bought their home six months ago, but, despite it being full to the brim with amazing original features, from fireplaces to balustrades and stained-glass windows, it needed some serious TLC. This renovation is a labour of love as the couple set about painstakingly restoring the features by themselves. He joins a party of dwarves who are on a mission to reclaim their lost homeland, which has been taken over by a dragon. When the group journeys into the Misty Mountains, Bilbo becomes separated from the dwarves and falls into a cave, where he finds himself confronted by Gollum and forced to play a riddle game. It is set in Middle-earth 60 years before the events of The Lord of the Rings and is the first part of Peter Jackson's fantasy adventure trilogy based on JRR Tolkien's novel, starring Martin Freeman, Ian McKellen, Richard Armitage, James Nesbitt, Ken Stott, Cate Blanchett, Ian Holm and Christopher Lee

programme.desc: The historian explores the story of the Egyptian pharaoh's life and death, and the discovery of his tomb, assisted by journalist John Sergeant and archaeologist Raksha Dave. In the first episode, Dan visits the Egyptian Museum in Cairo to examine the mummies of the boy king's parents - who were brother and sister, an incestuous relationship that may have had a serious impact on their son's health. Raksha visits a new excavation in the Valley of the Kings, while John gets a taste of a pharaoh's diet

Breaking new ground in portraiture and historical imagery, this giant of the Italian Renaissance used his wide-ranging skills to make a unique contribution to the development of European art

programme.title: Tony Robinson's History of Britain
programme.desc: The actor explores the lives of people from the Victorian era, including a 13-year-old girl who worked 14-hour shifts in a Bryant & May factory in London's East End, a woman who worked down a mine at Knowles Pitt near Bolton and a navvy who blasted tons of rock from the Highlands to help construct an ambitious water channel. Tony also hears the story of one of the first employees of Marks & Spencer.

programme.title: Tutankhamun with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan journeys back to 1323 BC, as he investigates an injury the pharaoh sustained towards the end of his life, an injury that would eventually result in his death. A scan of Tutankhamun's skeleton reveals a break to his thigh bone, and whilst visiting the Grand Egyptian Museum, Dan comes across 130 walking sticks which were found in his tomb, which suggest the young king was unable to walk unaided before his death

programme.title: Tutankhamun with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan investigates why the faces on Tut's coffins and canopic jars look more like a woman, and archaeologist Raksha Dave examines a recently restored box used for the pharaoh's clothes and discovers evidence to suggest it may actually have belonged to Nefertiti. Meanwhile, John Sergeant revisits his Strictly days as he learns how to dance like an Egyptian at a funeral

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow examines the life and legacy of German painter Albrecht Durer, who set a new benchmark in self-portraiture and raised the artistic reputation of northern Europe to a level rivaling that of Renaissance Italy. Like his contemporary Leonardo da Vinci, Durer perceived the world with a scientist's eye, and his detailed studies of plants and animals remain unrivalled to this day

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Charlie corrects Gareth's haphazard preparations for the firework display, but overlooks a Catherine wheel nailed too tightly to the door of Bessie's shed

programme.title: Hotel for Dogs (2009)
programme.desc: An orphaned brother and sister face losing their beloved dog when they go into a foster home that does not allow pets. The kids find the ideal hiding place in an abandoned hotel, and set about transforming it into luxury canine accommodation for not just their beloved pet, but every stray in town. Family comedy, starring Emma Roberts, Jake T Austin, Don Cheadle and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Rango (2011)
programme.desc: A pet chameleon with an active imagination ends up lost in the desert. He makes his way to a lawless town of animals, where he is mistaken for a deadly gunslinger and made sheriff. He organises the townsfolk into a posse when bandits led by an evil rattlesnake steal their supply of water. Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo (2011)
programme.desc: A father-of-two struggling to cope with the death of his wife is in need of a fresh start, so buys a house with a dilapidated zoo on the grounds. With the help of the keepers, he works to restore the attraction to its former glory, while also trying to reconnect with his troubled teenage son. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Matt Damon, Scarlett Johansson and Thomas Haden Church

programme.title: Now You See Me 2 (2016)
programme.desc: A gang of magicians-turned-criminals is reunited for a comeback performance by a ruthless technology magnate, whose actual goal is to force the team into carrying out a seemingly impossible heist on his behalf. The illusionists realise their only hope of avoiding the law is to perform one last unprecedented stunt to expose the businessman's illegal activities. Crime thriller sequel, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo, Daniel Radcliffe and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Alita: Battle Angel (2019)
programme.desc: In the 26th century, dismantled cyborg Alita is repaired by Dr Dyson Ido, a kindly technician with a dark secret. As she falls in love with local youth Hugo, the truth behind her mysterious past is eventually revealed. Director Robert Rodriguez's Sci-fi adventure based on the manga comic, starring Rosa Salazar, Christoph Waltz and Jennifer Connelly

programme.title: The Doorman (2020)
programme.desc: After a mission in Bucharest goes wrong, US Marine Ali Gorski comes back to New York disgraced, traumatised, and unemployed. When her uncle recommends a gig as a door guard, she agrees. However, when a band of criminal mercenaries intend to steal from her brother-in-law's apartment, Ali retaliates. Thriller, starring Ruby Rose and Jean Reno

programme.title: The Prodigy (2019)
programme.desc: A mother worried about her young son's erratic behaviour suspects something supernatural may be affecting him. Director Nicholas McCarthy's psychological horror, starring Taylor Schilling and Peter Mooney

programme.title: The Ghost and Mrs Muir (1947)
programme.desc: A lonely widow moves into a seaside cottage, despite rumours that it is haunted. Sure enough, she finds herself sharing her home with the spirit of a dead sea captain - but his efforts to scare her away prove unsuccessful, and instead a growing attraction develops between the pair as she agrees to write his biography. Romantic fantasy, starring Gene Tierney, Rex Harrison and George Sanders

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels (2010)
programme.desc: A directionless loser tries to prove himself to the woman he loves by volunteering for a travel writing assignment. He is sent to the Bermuda Triangle, where he ends up stranded on an island populated by miniature people to whom he is a giant. Fantasy comedy, starring Jack Black, Emily Blunt, Jason Segel and Billy Connolly

programme.title: Spies in Disguise (2019)
programme.desc: A secret agent branded a traitor tries to clear his name, with the aid of a socially awkward inventor he had fired for only developing non-lethal gadgets. The scientist's latest invention gets out of control and transforms the spy into a pigeon - giving him the perfect disguise to prove his innocence. Animated adventure, with the voices of Will Smith, Tom Holland and Karen Gillan

programme.title: Johnny English Strikes Again (2018)
programme.desc: A sinister cyber attack reveals the identity of all active undercover agents in Britain. Hapless secret agent Johnny English is sent on a mission to the South of France to protect Queen and country, and find the mastermind hacker responsible. Third movie in the comedy series, starring Rowan Atkinson, Ben Miller and Olga Kurylenko

programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle (2017)
programme.desc: Four teenagers play a jungle-themed game on an old console, only to find themselves transported into the game and transformed into its heroic characters. They must embark on a death-defying journey through the game's wilderness setting to make it back to the real world, or be stuck as video game characters forever. Fantasy action comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black

programme.title: Skyscraper (2018)
programme.desc: A former hostage negotiator takes a job as a security expert at the world's tallest building in Hong Kong. He finds himself framed for sabotage when the skyscraper bursts into flames. As he strives to clear his name, he must also fight his way back into the blazing tower to rescue his family, who are being held hostage by criminals 225 storeys up. Action thriller, starring Dwayne Johnson, Neve Campbell and Chin Han

programme.title: Hancock (2008)
programme.desc: A reluctant, alcoholic superhero ends up the most hated man in Los Angeles thanks to his habit of causing mayhem and destruction while trying to do good. However, when he saves the life of a PR guru, the grateful executive sets about transforming the public perception of the crime-fighter, despite his wife's strong misgivings. Comedy, starring Will Smith, Jason Bateman and Charlize Theron

programme.title: The Beast (2019)
programme.desc: Two Seoul police detectives are both in the running for the post of homicide department chief. However, they have to put aside their differences to solve the brutal murder of a schoolgirl. Director Jung-Ho Lee's drama, starring Sung-min Lee, Jae-myung Yoo and Daniel Choi. In Korean

programme.title: The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water (2015)
programme.desc: The cheery sea creature tries to prevent a precious secret formula from falling into the wrong hands - but when it goes missing, the end of the world approaches. SpongeBob and his friends embark on a quest to get it back, which leads to them developing superpowers and venturing onto dry land. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny and Antonio Banderas

programme.title: Black Knight (2001)
programme.desc: An employee at a run-down medieval theme park suffers a nasty fall and knocks himself out - only to wake up in 14th-century England, where he gets up to all manner of mischief with the knights in shining armour and damsels in distress. Comedy adventure, starring Martin Lawrence, Tom Wilkinson and Marsha Thomason

programme.title: The Black Shield of Falworth (1954)
programme.desc: The son of a disgraced medieval nobleman is raised in poverty. With the support of a kindly earl, he gains the chance to train as a knight and reclaim his birthright, proving his worth by fighting to foil a plot to overthrow the king. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Tony Curtis, Janet Leigh, David Farrar and Barbara Rush

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army (1960)
programme.desc: A naval officer is given the command of an old sailing ship to undertake a very important mission - to transport an Australian agent into enemy waters so he can spy on the Japanese. However, he finds the ship is falling apart at the seams and is manned by a crew that does not know how to sail her. Second World War comedy, with Jack Lemmon, Ricky Nelson, John Lund, Chips Rafferty and Tom Tully

programme.title: Junior (1994)
programme.desc: A fertility expert pioneers a treatment enabling men to become pregnant and carry babies to full term. When the authorities cancel funding for the research, he decides to test it on himself, but gives little thought to how difficult it will be to keep it a secret. The situation is further complicated when he starts to fall for the woman whose child he is carrying. Comedy, with Arnold Schwarzenegger, Danny DeVito, Emma Thompson and Frank Langella

programme.title: The Predator (2018)
programme.desc: When a young boy accidentally signals the galaxy's most lethal hunters who set course for Earth, an eclectic band of former soldiers and a scientist attempt to prevent the end of the human race. Director Shane Black's fourth entry in the sci-fi thriller saga, starring Boyd Holbrook, Trevante Rhodes, Jacob Tremblay, Keegan-Michael Key and Olivia Munn

programme.title: La Haine (1995)
programme.desc: Three men from different racial backgrounds hang around their tough neighbourhood in the aftermath of a riot in which one of their friends was critically injured by the police. However, one of the trio has a secret - he has obtained a gun that a policeman lost during the fighting, and plans to put it to vengeful use if his friend dies. Drama, starring Vincent Cassel, Hubert Kounde and Said Taghmaoui. In French

programme.title: Hyena (2014)
programme.desc: A corrupt cop with access to all the money and drugs he needs suddenly finds his comfortable way of life turned upside down by the arrival of ruthless Albanian gangsters in his patch of London. Crime thriller, starring Peter Ferdinando, Stephen Graham and Neil Maskell

programme.desc: When Beverly announces a family vacation to Miami, Erica suspects she is up to something, and Murray grapples with his fear of flying

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: Matt Lucas and Noel Fielding welcome AJ Odudu, Gemma Collins, Jessica Hynes and Tim Key to the tent for the second of this year's star-studded special editions for the charity campaign. programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay accidentally gatecrashes Mitch and Cameron's night out with their friends Pepper, Longines and Crispin, but surprisingly enjoys his time with the group. Meanwhile, Phil and Claire are concerned when Luke befriends neighbour Mr Kleezak, and despite Cameron's misgivings, Haley babysits Lily. Guest starring Nathan Lane (The Producers)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cameron is delighted to accept the role of interim music director at Luke and Manny's school, but his enthusiasm fails to rub off on the students. Meanwhile, Jay's brother Donnie (guest star Jonathan Banks) comes to town, but their sibling rivalry goes too far, and Phil persuades his family to appear in his new advert

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitchell and Cameron seek legal guardians for Lily and begin secretly assessing their family members. The duo's decision is made difficult, however, when they catch Jay dishing out tough love to Manny, and find out that Clare has been taking Luke to a child psychologist due to his lack of development

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire and Gloria hope to spend time with their children outdoors, but their plan backfires. Meanwhile, Phil witnesses an unexpected moment of weakness from Jay. American comedy, starring Julie Bowen, Sofia Vergara and Ty Burrell

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire and Phil swap parenting roles, Gloria falls for a sob story, and Jay helps an overzealous entrepreneur with his dog training scheme. Meanwhile, Mitch finds himself torn between looking after Cam, who is in bed with flu, and attending a Lady Gaga concert. Comedy, directed by The Wonder Years star Fred Savage, featuring Julie Bowen, Ty Burrell and Sofia Vergara

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the comedy about scientists and their friendship with a down-to-earth neighbour. When aspiring actress Penny moves into Leonard's apartment block, he is immediately smitten, but Sheldon warns him that he runs the risk of a broken heart if he tries to woo her. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is upset when a magazine fails to mention him in an article about the paper he co-wrote with Sheldon. Meanwhile, a power cut at Mrs Wolowitz's home leads to a final family dinner in her honour. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Leonard and Sheldon are invited to speak at UC Berkeley, they decide to take a detour and try to meet one of their idols - Star Wars director George Lucas. Meanwhile, Raj and Amy offer to settle a dispute with a game of table tennis. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard finds out that he has a half-brother, Sheldon and Amy have a platonic sleepover, and Penny gets an offer to audition for a Kevin Smith film. American comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj is asked to create a message on the off-chance a Nasa mission discovers alien life, and the guys fight over what he should do. Meanwhile, Penny contemplates returning to acting. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: Transformers (2007)
programme.desc: Teenager Sam Witwicky is treated to his first car by his dad, but it turns out to be an alien scout with a life of its own. Before long, the vehicle embroils Sam in a long-running intergalactic war between two factions of giant shape-changing robots, which have come to Earth to find a mystical cube that grants infinite power to its possessor. Michael Bay's sci-fi action adventure, inspired by the toy franchise, with Shia LaBeouf, Megan Fox, Josh Duhamel, Jon Voight and John Turturro

They also share their thoughts on the coverage of the funeral of the Duke of Edinburgh and Good Morning Britain's report of an altercation between Labour leader Keir Starmer and a pub landlord

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Former model Joe knows exactly how to charm, but he finds himself working for the affections of personal shopper Nicole. Devout Christian Tawanda gets to know Marvin, a Trevor Nelson doppelganger, while Essex girl Sian is on the hunt for her dream man - and Londoner Tom ticks all the right boxes. There's a linguistic battle of wits between Irish fashionista Laura and her date Frankie, with explosive results, and confident Charlie hopes to right his previous relationship wrongs as he meets one-time ballet dancer Nelly

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Dating show in which singletons meet up with potential partners at a restaurant, having selected them based solely on an internet photograph. First through the doors is Anna, who has a lengthy list of what she wants from her perfect man, Will her date Liam tick all the boxes? Linguist Louis is struggling to learn the language of love, and within seconds of meeting Adela, his nerves takes hold and silence descends on the table. Meanwhile, Michael and Karina share their experiences of parenthood, and writer Louis seems more concerned with the price of the meal as he meets spiritual barmaid Amber

programme.title: Below Deck
programme.desc: Heather and the crew plan a 1980s-themed surprise 75th birthday party, while Eddie is forced to put his first-officer training on the back burner to babysit his crew

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jill and Paul Phillips hope to move to a smallholding and lead a self-sufficient life in Brittany, north-west France, so Danni Menzies shows them five properties for their budget of £135,000 hoping to find the right home for them

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Taekwondo-loving house hunters Gill and Mark from south Wales are looking to make a permanent move to the beautiful countryside of the Charente. With £110,000 and Ben Hillman on hand to help, will they like any of the five properties he has lined up enough to make it theirs?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Husband and wife Carol and Steve's three biological children and several foster children have all now left home, and the duo are now ready for a new challenge. programme.title: Jonathan Ross' Myths and Legends
programme.desc: Jonathan is joined by Neil Gaiman in the Isle of Skye and the Scottish Highlands, who reveals how the Isle is steeped in myths and legends and is a source of inspiration to him. Jonathan visits Dunscaith Castle, home to one of Skye's legendary warrior queens, before travelling across the island to find out about Skye's fairyfolk, reputed to be able to magically bestow musical ability

programme.title: Home Greek Home

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-three Virginia Houslin opens the contest in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, and her hopes for some flirtatious fun are boosted by the arrival of her first guest, wedding singer Richard Wood. However the cheeky host faces a battle to win over the taste buds of her other diners as she tries to stake her claim for the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business development manager Iyesha Atkins hosts the second dinner party in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, hoping her sophisticated event will win her the £1,000 prize. However, the evening does not go to plan when Virginia finds fault with Iyesha's main course, and the two women fall out following a discussion about religion

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wedding singer and confident cook Richard Wood hosts the third dinner party in Huddersfield. With steak on the menu, he opts not to listen to his guests' preferences and instead cooks and serves them his own way. However, with the starter a disaster and the rift between mum-of-three Virginia and ladette Iyesha deepening, Richard believes the only solution to save his night is for him to sing

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Tommy Mack hosts the fourth dinner-party challenge from Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, and tries to woo his guests with a Hollywood silent movie-themed evening, which includes a selection of mystery dishes and his very own style of rapping

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kim Connor hosts the final party in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, hoping her American diner-themed menu will delight her guests. Sweating over a hot stove is not what the glamorous hairdresser is used to, and she relies on helpful advice from her mother. The food fails to appeal to everyone's tastes, but Kim's after-dinner entertainment seems to revive her flagging chances of success

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week kicks off at Creates Monmouth in Monmouthshire, where a peaceful night's sleep is ruined by an early morning fire alarm and a lack of privacy bothers one guest

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rivals stay over at Coastal Park Accommodation in Llanelli, where an evening drinks session turns tense when Billy confronts hosts Claire and Tony about their business model

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third week's location is the Queens at Horton in Shropshire, run by Tracy and Billy Scott. The rivals are wowed by the luxury rooms - until Tracy finds a screw loose, that is

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners converge at Caroline Weaver's Whychurch Farm Glamping in Wiltshire. Kenny and Ben are pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness, but Billy and Tracy feel a little cramped in their pod. A day spent helping out on the on-site farm isn't to everyone's taste, but an evening barbecue is a massive hit

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Payment day finds the B&Bers ready to settle some scores. First to get some answers on their feedback are Kenny and Ben, who want to take a peek at Caroline's privacy issues and reveal why they found her sleep score alarming. Next, Tony and Claire confront Kenny and Ben on a 'wee problem', and chew over Billy and Tracy's breakfast score - who in turn want to clear up Claire and Tony's cleanliness comments

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old Tulsi is airlifted to St George's after falling from a cliff near her home in Hastings, and CT scans reveal she requires emergency brain surgery. Meanwhile, 39-year-old Adam is rushed to A&E after his motorbike collided with a car, leaving him with an obvious and painful leg injury, and 70-year-old retired mechanic Ron is treated after trapping his hand between two vehicles while helping his friend fix their car

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 22-year-old cyclist is rushed to St George's Hospital after he collided with a car on the way to work and 'bullseyed' its rear window. Since he was not wearing a helmet, doctors send him for a CT scan to assess whether he has sustained a serious head injury, or life-changing damage to his neck, spine or internal organs. Meanwhile, 91-year-old Peter arrives at A&E three nights after suffering a fall at home, and 26-year-old Emma needs treatment for a head wound sustained during an epileptic seizure

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, with Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan taking on guest captain Richard Ayoade and Katherine Ryan. Bill Bailey is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent, while Rachel Riley is in charge of the letters and numbers

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, with Jon Richardson and Cariad Lloyd taking on guest captain Alan Carr and Kevin Bridges. Elis James and John Robins join Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.desc: A 22-year-old cyclist is rushed to St George's Hospital after he collided with a car on the way to work and 'bullseyed' its rear window. Since he was not wearing a helmet, doctors send him for a CT scan to assess whether he has sustained a serious head injury, or life-changing damage to his neck, spine or internal organs. programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt present some of their favourite investigations. In Israel, Kate unearths the mystery ingredient that makes icing sugar so light, fluffy and powdery. In Iceland, Jimmy investigates Skyr, a mysterious yoghurt-like product, and in Cornwall, Matt dives for edible seaweed that has started cropping up on supermarket shelves

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect revisits his travels, starting off in Canada, near the Rocky Mountain town of Golden. George finds himself face to face with a 2000lb buffalo and visits a stunning self-built log farmhouse. And on the Coromandel Peninsula in New Zealand, George visits an epic panoramic beach house

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: Greg and Helen Watson have bought a home in one of the most expensive areas of Sheffield, South Yorkshire, but it's too cramped for their needs and needs renovating. What's more, their third child is due in 18 weeks and they are desperate to move in before then. Architects Howard Evans and Prue Chiles are given the job, but with the Covid-19 lockdown, the wettest month on record and some major design differences, the build is in danger of collapsing before their £120,000 budget runs out

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke returns to unlock the potential of old houses. He meets teachers Simon and Sofie, whose 1930s Liverpool semi has lost its way thanks to a small kitchen squeezed into what would have been the wash house and some dodgy interior design choices made by the previous owner. Can he come up with a structural redesign and interior scheme with just £15,000? He also visits a medieval farmhouse in Kent that's like a perfectly preserved time capsule and needs an upgrade suitable for a young and rapidly growing family

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gemma Willock hosts the first party in the West Midlands, and her evening of glitz and glamour looks set to be a roaring success until an unwelcome revelation about her corner-cutting approach to the competition threatens her chances of taking the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mortgage adviser Andrew Devey throws the second party in the West Midlands, hosting a beatnik-themed evening. He cooks shepherd's pie for his main course, as well as lining up some pop art in the hope that it will expand his guests' minds

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Vegetarian Jules Evans hosts the third day of the competition in the West Midlands, and plans to indulge her passion for historical re-enactments by planning a medieval-themed dinner. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Massage therapist Lucy Hird hosts the fourth dinner party from the West Midlands, featuring an extensive menu full of Thai specialities. She also gives individual presents to her guests, but her night is compromised by the entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mental-health nurse Lloyd Cast hosts the final dinner party from the West Midlands. Despite appearing to be an extrovert so far, he decides on a chilled theme for the evening to allow his food to take centre stage, before the winner of the £1,000 is announced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's first visit is to Carly Cornwall's Juniperlea Inn in Midlothian, where the roadside location causes sleepless nights and one guest announces that they would not return

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rivals arrive at Starshinezzz in County Durham, where laid-back host Dave Taylor hopes his renowned hospitality will make him a winner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests are charmed by Barney Smith's Hobbit-style accommodation at the Hideaway at Baxby Manor in North Yorkshire - although the loos are not quite what they expected

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The Hideout Hotel in Hull, run by Jodie Richardson and Enya Donohoe, is the final destination of the week. The hands-off check-in and self-catered apartments prove popular with some guests, but Barney kicks up a stink in the bathroom. During the DIY breakfast, Jodie's handling of a smoky situation sets alarm bells ringing for Carly and Lydia, and feedback leaves the hosts fired up with payment day looming

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On payment day, Carly from the Juniperlea Inn is keen for Barney to enlighten her on the reasons behind his sleep issues. Barney is in the spotlight again when his payment to Jodie and Enya makes tensions run high. There are plenty of differences to be debated before the winner is announced

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

Rather than focusing on the cooking, he creates his own school fete and tries to wow everyone with a selection of outdoor games as he vies for the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: International development manager Hawa Sydique hosts the fourth dinner party from Cambridge, and her adventurous menu seems to cause more problems than it is worth. However, she hopes to impress with the 20-piece samba band in her living room, but the other guests are a little overwhelmed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beatles-loving Scouser David Goodier hosts the final dinner party in Cambridge and is determined to impress his guests with a 1960s Merseybeat dress code and courses entitled 'Spicy Beatballs' and 'Tir-Mersey-su'. As the evening draws to a close, the winner of the £1,000 cash prize is revealed

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Liam, 31, is rushed to St George's after collapsing at home after his fourth epileptic seizure of the day, and he experiences another at the hospital, while 89-year-old Mair is brought to A&E with severe chest pain and difficulty breathing and doctors take blood samples to test whether her symptoms are due to pneumonia. Twelve-year-old Lauren arrives by ambulance after breaking her leg while scoring a try in a rugby match and she needs extensive surgery to give her the best chance of walking normally again

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics are called to reports of a man collapsed in the street and in cardiac arrest. When they arrive, he's surrounded by police officers who've been carrying out CPR. In other cases, a woman in severe abdominal pain has a panic attack as the paramedics try to get her breathing under control, while a man with a fast heart rate is vomiting blood

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: First episode of the medical drama about a young surgeon with autism and savant syndrome who is trying to make his way in a prestigious big-city hospital. Freddie Highmore stars

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Air ambulance crews race to mountain emergencies in the Lake District, as a walker goes into cardiac arrest on the banks of Ullswater and a biker is injured on a remote road

Twelve-year-old Lauren arrives by ambulance after breaking her leg while scoring a try in a rugby match and she needs extensive surgery to give her the best chance of walking normally again

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt present some of their favourite investigations. Kate heads to Spain in pursuit of the perfect tomato and finds herself slap bang in the middle of the world's biggest food fight. Jimmy visits Italy to investigate the difference between risotto rice and long grain. Matt finds out why pork scratchings aren't made from British pigs

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp enlists the help of paper-cutting expert Poppy Chancellor to make personalised wedding invitations for a couple about to tie the knot. Plus, the inventive presenter creates a craft collage to celebrate the arrival of a newborn baby

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: North Yorkshire couple Mike and Dianne Tibbet love the island of Malta and are now in a position to find a holiday home on the island to use as a holiday base where they plan to spend more quality time with Dianne's three cousins who live there. Danni Menzies uses her property know-how to show them a mix of potential homes for a budget of £160,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A family of four hope to turn their passion for cycling into profit by opening a bicycle tour company in France and a diving instructor in Marbella buys out his only competitor

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien attempt to restore items including an old cheese press, and a 1980s motorbike almost gets the better of Henry and his restorer Guy

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Max McMurdo restore and upcycle 2CV headlamps, a children's rocking horse, a Victorian streetlamp and a high chair

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers look for an heir to the estate of Brian Yanchuk, a man from Milton Keynes with links to 19th-century Canada and the Second World War, and an investigation into the beneficiaries of Alexander Gibson leads the team to a family secret. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs are yet to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins in Abersoch at NightSky Glamping. After a trip to the local beach for an afternoon bodyboarding, Morgan reveals that he isn't a fan of camping

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Johnny Dough's Restaurant with Rooms in Conwy, North Wales, run by Morgan Austin, where a hairy bed gets Kadir's stay off on the wrong foot

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The Royal Oak in the Peak District, run by Kadir Ustun, is the week's third location, but mould in their respective bathrooms puts off two sets of guests straight away

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sam Harrison and Sophie Germany host the final visit of the week at the Dovecote Inn in Nottinghamshire. Morgan marvels at his room, but Kadir is determined to inspect every nook and cranny after receiving frosty feedback from Sam and Sophie when he hosted. An underwhelming day out touring the village of Laxton is saved only by the hosts' personalities, though later two of the B&Bers have a disagreement over dinner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On payment day, Angie and Caitlin are keen to get to the bottom of some cutlery quibbles. Morgan's upset about some cleanliness complaints, while Kadir thinks some of his fellow B&Bers have been unfair by saying they wouldn't return to his B&B

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are house-hunting for two couples who are keen to get on the property ladder in Swindon. Kirstie meets Candice and Alistair, who are looking to move out of Alistair's bachelor pad and into a family home as they are expecting the arrival of their first baby. Meanwhile, Phil is in the countryside between Swindon and Newbury where he meets James and Hayley, who are looking for a rural retreat for themselves and their two dogs

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help a pair of baptist ministers with their four-bedroom in Alnwick, Northumberland. Having grown up on the same street, Chris is ready for a change of scenery and a bigger, more user-friendly space for combining work and family needs - including fitting up to 14 people round a dining table. Caroline, however, loves their home, and particularly the neighbours who brought her, Chris and their teenagers comfort while she was undergoing cancer treatment

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: At Chateau de Lalande, Stephanie and Gerry go bold with a colourful project in the tower staircase that Stephanie wants to turn in to a pigeonniere - a place to keep pigeons. In cognac country, Sarah and George are under pressure renovating a bedroom in time for a wedding in just a week's time. Cameras also return to Chateau de la Ruche, where Tim and Rebecca's gite conversion has moved on to the next stage

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Greg and Georgie who are taking on the highly ambitious task of converting a dilapidated, 35-year-old barn in Kent. The build will be a huge challenge involving the painstaking conservation of the existing rotten structure, building a new two-storey internal steel frame and recycling everything they can to stretch their £250,000 budget

programme.title: Jonathan Ross' Myths and Legends
programme.desc: Jonathan delves into the truth behind the legends of King Arthur, goes in search of the Beast of Bodmin, and pays a visit to fantasy artist Brian Froud. His journey around the British Isles ends at Glastonbury Tor, where he meets an Earth Priestess and assists in a ceremony in tribute to the Arthurian enchantress Morgan Le Fay

programme.title: Skeletons of the Mary Rose: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Scientists and historians use isotope and DNA analysis to identify the crew of Henry VIII's flagship, which sank off the coast of Portsmouth in 1545. With the help of Mary Rose Trust curator Alex Hildred, the programme uncovers evidence that many of the sailors were of African origin, and traces surviving descendants of the only two members of the crew who can be identified by name. Plus, the little-known story of a 16th-century Guinean free-diver who retrieved several treasures from the wreck

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 71-year-old woman is rushed in after being knocked over by her husband's car, and her blood pressure has dropped critically low. Four-year-old Maddi is brought in with an injured neck after falling over on a train, and doctors worry that metal plates she already had in her neck may have shifted, causing damage to her spine. Plus, 68-year-old Bonnie arrives after hitting her head on her bedside table

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A crew battles bad weather in Cumbria to reach injured 70-year-old hill-walker Jenny, while Scott's attempts at DIY land him in serious trouble, and biker Ronald needs urgent treatment after a crash

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick journeys inland from the majestic Camel Estuary to one of Britain's finest vineyards, where he joins in harvesting the grapes to discover that the Cornish weather is perfect making some of the best wine in the country. Just off Pentire Point, as the sun sets, Rick rides the gentle swell of the north Atlantic with an old friend, casting his line to hook Britain's fastest fish, before firing up the barbecue to cook his catch with a recipe inspired from a trip to Goa. Rick joins Tim Smit, best known for starting the hugely successful Eden Project, who reveals to Rick his new and ambitious idea in Cornwall

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall

Richard Hammond is in South Africa, where he tests the Marauder, a bigger, more rugged alternative to the Humvee, and James May enlists the help of 2010 Winter Olympic skeleton gold medallist Amy Williams and former Intercontinental Rally Challenge champion Kris Meeke to try out a Mini rally car. Plus, the Stig takes the BMW 1 Series M Coupe around the test track and Alice Cooper gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer return to Scotland for their latest fishing trip. Having failed to catch a salmon in the River Tay, they hope to have more luck on the Tweed. They begin their journey at the isolated Bemersyde Estate before moving on to the Bridge Pool at Kelso, one of the most famous salmon fishing spots in Scotland. They also try their hand at boat fishing and receive some mystical predictions from a familiar face

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer are joined by Feargal Sharkey for a trip to the River Lea in Hertfordshire, where Paul used to fish for perch with his friends when he was a teenager. Bob reads up on the wise words of 17th-century angler Izaak Walton and prepares a riverside picnic that brings back fond memories and leads to a reflection on the differences between teenage life in their 1970s youth and the present. Setting up home in a narrowbooat, he also prepares a dish Paul's mother used to make - corned beef and potato pie

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing

As they arrive and get their gear together, Bob introduces Paul to the surprisingly varied contents of his car boot, much to Paul's amusement. They gather their equipment and find a decent spot that should give them plenty of chances to catch and make camp for the day. They end their trip with a visit to a local pub, where Bob reveals a hidden trick

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a military strong-hold in the Philippines, a facility that spawned an American sporting great, and an English relic that hosted a cinematic sensation

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo experiences first-hand Italy's 'need for speed' in a state-of-the-art Maserati sports car, and discovers how the leaning tower of Pisa was rescued from near collapse. In Carrara, he finds out how the marble used by Michelangelo is still being quarried and is invited to chip away at a contemporary sculpture. Moving on to Bologna, the former politician embarks on a doomed search for spaghetti bolognese before being taught how to prepare a tagliatelle al ragu. Finally, he lets the wind rush through his hair on a high-speed boat trip across Lake Garda

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a Greek odyssey from the Athens port of Piraeus, north to the city of Thessaloniki, exploring the Acropolis and sampling moussaka and baklava on the way. He also discovers the parlous state of Greek finances at the time of his 1913 Continental Railway Guide, and learns how an aristocratic English poet became a Greek national hero

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures deep into the Black Forest, where he discovers how Hansel and Gretel helped to unify the German nation. A masterclass in carving cuckoo clocks demonstrates how the nation's reputation for quality and reliability in manufacturing was established. Later, at Goettingen University, the former politician discovers two sides of student life at the turn of the 20th century - the duelling fraternities and the ground-breaking scientists who laid the foundation of Germany's world-class transport technology

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo traces the early 20th-century roots of the Spanish Civil War, which divided his family and sent his father into exile. The former politician discovers a nation fractured at the time by social tensions and regional loyalties, which today offer a rich diversity of cultures to delight the tourist. After arriving in Majorca from Barcelona, Michael spoils himself enjoying spectacular scenic views aboard a 1912 vintage railway and a 1913 tram. He also gets trampled underfoot at the bottom of a Catalan 'people steeple' and learns to make the perfect paella

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his trusty 1913 Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo ventures east through Romania to the shores of the Black Sea. Along the way he encounters a bloodsucking vampire in Transylvania and brown bears in the Carpathian forest, before visiting a fairytale castle with modern conveniences in Sinaia, striking oil in Ploiesti, tapping into the nation's musical soul in Bucharest and loading cargo from a crane in Constanta. This leg of his journey ends at Constanta, where Michael explores what is now emerging as Europe's largest grain port

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels from the Swiss Alps to the shores of Lake Geneva. Along the way, he is caught up in a war zone with the Red Cross and rescued from an 'avalanche' by a St Bernard puppy. He takes to the skies in a vintage bi-plane to retrace the epic journey of the pioneering pilot who was first to fly over the Alps, and tries his hand at watchmaking, James Bond style

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.desc: Field Marshal Montgomery's daring airborne plan to end the war by Christmas, which went a bridge too far at Arnhem

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
