programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On his journey from Swindon to Penzance, Michael Portillo explores Torquay, where he meets meteorologist David Braine to find out whether the town is Britain's warmest spot. He then takes a trip on the Paignton and Dartmouth Steam Railway, and spends the night at the Royal Castle Hotel in Dartmouth, where he learns about the town's naval past. After sailing up the River Dart he arrives in Totnes, and discovers the community's efforts to become more environmentally friendly

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo spends the night in a converted post office railway carriage before continuing his journey from Swindon to Penzance, heading for Par, where he meets miner Ivor Bowditch to explore the largest clay mine in the world. In Mevagissey he discovers how the methods for pilchard fishing have changed over the years, and on a visit to the Lost Gardens of Heligan, Michael learns about the 1,000-acre estate's history

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo undertakes the last leg of his journey from Swindon to Penzance. He travels to Perran Sands, where he searches for the lost church of St Piran, a place believed to be one of the earliest Christian sites in England. In Redruth, he explores the remains of the Cornish tin industry, before heading to St Ives, where he spends the night in Treganna Castle. The former politician finishes his trip in Penzance, discovering how railways link remote communities to the rest of the country

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey to London from Buxton, Derbyshire, where he discovers how railways inspired a building craze and boosted tourism. In the Peak District, he joins a team of volunteers repairing damage done to ancient peat landscapes during the Industrial Revolution, and near the quarries of Stanton Moor he learns how trains transported Derbyshire's famous sandstone all over England

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the second leg of his journey from Buxton to London, stopping at Cromford, Derbyshire, where Bradshaw's railway guide reports Richard Arkwright built his original cotton mill. He also visits Derby to take a walk through Britain's first public park, and heads for Burton-on-Trent for a tour of Burton Bridges Breweries

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's journey from Buxton to London continues in Walsall, where he visits a leather business that still supplies the Queen with saddlery. He then explores how the centre of Birmingham has changed since Bradshaw's times, and is taught how to cook a curry by the owner of a leading Indian restaurant. Finally, he heads to the village of Bournville, where he learns how the railway transformed the fortunes of the Cadbury brothers

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues the final leg of his journey, meeting a survivor of the Coventry Blitz and exploring how the city has been rebuilt since the 1940 bombardment. Reaching Aylesbury in Buckinghamshire, he stops overnight at Hartwell House and visits the area's last pure-breed duck farmer, before heading to Watford in Hertfordshire to learn about Operation Pied Piper

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches London, where he continues to discover what remains of George Bradshaw's Britain. Arriving at St Pancras, he learns about the station's troubled history and £800million makeover, before travelling along the world's first underground line from King's Cross to Farringdon. The trip comes to an end at the Houses of Parliament, where he climbs the clock tower and meets the men responsible for keeping Big Ben working

However, she puts her foot in it right from the start with publican Sis - likening her to a sloth. With tensions already running high with Debs, things take a turn for the awkward over mains when Nikki lets her real feelings out and things get heated around the table. Nikki cannot quite get her crowd going with her entertainment as she performs Man I Feel Like a Woman - even if it does get fellow ally Barry in the dancing mood

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Bev Cameron has multiple sclerosis and finds that a warm climate helps her manage her symptoms. As a response, she has decided to buy a property near the historic harbour town of Paphos, in Cyprus. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Reality TV star and choreographer Louie Spence and his husband Leto Fernandez have long-dreamed of owning a holiday home in Spain's Almeria Province - somewhere to spend the winter months and short summer breaks with friends and family. Laura Hamilton is on hand to show them five properties within their £185,000 budget, but will any of them have Louie high-kicking with delight?

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A Nottinghamshire couple take over a massive property in France, a business executive gives it all up to run an organic farm in the Italian mountains, and a couple from London fall in love with a rundown hotel in Spain

programme.desc: In Andalusia, it's launch day at a couple's new hotel. In south west France, two gîte owners from Nottinghamshire are dealt a financial blow and in Italy, an unexpected injury puts a group of organic farmers under strain

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Married couple Steve and Dawn first visited Mijas on the eastern coast of Spain 11 years ago and have wanted to own a holiday home there ever since. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Having fallen in love with Italy on their honeymoon, Bob and Lucretia from Southampton are hoping to buy their perfect holiday home in the stunning Puglia region. With a budget of £100,000, property expert Laura Hamilton sets out to make their dreams a reality by selecting five places from them to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Married couple Martin and Kate are taking the huge step of buying their first property together overseas - around the Mar Menor in Spain. After a difficult few years they cannot wait to find a holiday bolthole they can enjoy with their two sons Tommy and Charlie for extended breaks. Jean Johansson shows them around five properties in the hope one will be perfect for them and their family with their budget of £90,000

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go house-hunting to help one family and one pair of first-time buyers navigate the Bristol market. Kirstie's poker-loving couple, Liz and Ben, want to buy in their beloved Clifton where they have been renting. Meanwhile, Phil's searching for Greg and Joanna, who want to find a property in a family-friendly area within walking distance of daughter Oliwia's new school

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets retired racehorse breeder John and his wife Helen in Dunstable. The couple met at Newbury races in 2005 and wed two years later, living together in a 17th-century farmhouse until illness struck in 2018. Helen had a catastrophic stroke, severely affecting her mobility and leaving her with aphasia, which affects her ability to communicate. Constrained by the steep stairs, narrow doorways and changes in level of their current home, John resolved to make a big change in their lives with the purchase of a nearby two-acre plot. Following the demolition of an old, dilapidated house on site, a new high-tech accessible pavilion, complete with wildlife garden, will be built in its place for £1.3million

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Two-part special following the case of a naked man found stabbed to death in Luton, which leads police to discover this may be one of a series of murders in which men are lured with the promise of sex, so that they can be robbed. DI Dale Mepstead turns her attention to two men who are seen on CCTV accompanying the suspects into a flat. Will either of the women being held in custody reveal their identity?

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: When a man is found dead and completely naked after bleeding out from a stab wound to his thigh, Bedfordshire's Major Crime unit charge two women who they believe enticed the man into meeting them with the promise of sex, but instead had the intention of robbing him. CCTV reveals the women were accompanied by two men on the night of the murder. Now with four suspects in custody, investigators need to work out who is behind the 'honey trap' plot and which of their suspects is responsible for the murder

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: Celebrity Hunted

The hunters being armed with the powers of the state - CCTV and ANPR cameras, drones, dogs, mobile phone tracking and social media publicity campaigns, means the celebrities have to be creative to evade capture. As the competitors escape from Shrewsbury prison and go on the run, the hunters are instantly on their tails, tracking them with CCTV cameras and a helicopter. All in aid of Stand Up To Cancer, James and Ed make a daring move with a six-course tasting menu at a Michelin guide restaurant while Nik and Eva escape on a tandem bike

programme.title: Night Coppers

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: This episode focuses on a day at St George's during the global pandemic. Colin, 79, is rushed to the hospital after collapsing in his garage. Doctors are concerned that he has suffered a stroke, but he has also recently been diagnosed with a brain tumour. Tony is in minor injuries with crippling pain in his fingers. The 88-year-old reflects on his life, his love of dancing and how he believes the pandemic has brought out best in people

programme.title: Derry Girls

But while Erin is excited about sharing her wisdom with her house guest, Katya turns out to be a lot less grateful to be in Derry than expected. Meanwhile, the rest of the family has other preoccupations - a new development in Granda Joe's love life that leaves his daughters deeply unimpressed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

Now, although they've never been to Spain, they've decided that Almería has the perfect balance of sunshine and affordable property. Laura Hamilton shows them five homes for their £100,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas comes to the aid of brothers Dave and Richard Paine, who are looking for a home in Portugal's Algarve that can serve as a winter retreat for their parents, but could also be used by their families for holidays throughout the rest of the year

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Tracy from Southport wishes to find the perfect country property, which she can one day turn into a B&B. She's always dreamed of relocating to France and after a recent divorce feels that now is the right time to do it. With a budget of £100,000, Jonnie Irwin sets out to find the ideal place for her

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Tracey and Iain from south Wales are looking to buy a holiday home in Ibiza after they fell in love with the island on a family holiday six years ago. They're especially drawn to the pretty town of Santa Eularia and have set their hearts on somewhere with a sea view, so call upon the skills of property expert Ben Hillman to find them the home of their dreams for their £275,000 budget

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil look back on two sets of couples who struggled to decide whether to stick to their roots or move on to pastures new. In Wandsworth, south London Rachel and Tim debated over city or country. While they both agreed their 1930s semi was too small for their family of four, how to move forward was their issue. In Lincoln, Carly and Eric had a similar situation with their two-bed bungalow being too small for them and their family and while Eric thought their only choice was to move, Carly was adamant she wouldn't leave her close family support network behind

programme.desc: Bear Grylls ventures into Ukraine by invitation of President Zelenskyy where he meets civilians who are trying to endure and survive the war to learn what life is like for them. On his way to meet the President in Kyiv, he visits the old front line in Irpin where he meets soldier Oleksandr who joined the army to fight the Russian invasion and journalist Alina who lost her father to the war

programme.desc: Some of the trekkers are becoming more and more swayed towards alienating the rest of the group and splurging some of the prize money on home comforts. Can they resist sugary sweetness and an evening in a living room that reminds them of everything back home?

programme.desc: Men with exceptionally large penises reveal how this has affected their lives, from the embarrassment of people staring and difficulties with clothing, to uncomfortable sex and even causing injuries to their partners. While some have learned to live with the implications of their unusual bodies, others are considering surgical solutions to reduce the size

programme.desc: Trainee nurse Melissa has size MM breasts and wants to lighten the load, while personal trainer Leah would love leaner legs. But as they both confront their life-size naked avatars, will they decide to push ahead with their plans for surgery, or will their minds be changed by what they see in front of them and hear from our feedback panel?

programme.title: Fortress Britain with Alice Roberts
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts, Professor Danielle George and Dr Onyeka Nubia examines surviving evidence of Britain's preparation for a Nazi land invasion during the second World War, including the tragic story of one of the war's forgotten heroines. Alice learns about the deployment of the Home Guard, and Danielle travels to the Channel Islands to visit the only concentration camp to be built on British soil

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the last night in the West Midlands, and mole-catcher Michael intends to impress his guests with his night of fancy French cuisine, including a controversial main course

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Having inherited some money, Hampshire couple Phil and Bernie Smith are now in a position of being able to afford a holiday home. They have decided that south Tenerife's warm winter climate is ideal for whenever Phil's work as a gardener in the UK slows down, so Scarlette Douglas shows them five apartments within their £100,000 budget for them to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Avon Dixon and Giovanna Piscopo from Leicestershire are looking for a holiday home in the Dordogne region of France that will serve as a summer getaway until they can retire there in a few years' time. Ben Hillman shows them what their £100,000 will buy them in this stunning rural corner of the country

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A former B&B owner launches her tapas walking tours in Spain, it's the busiest day of the year for some farmers in Italy, and the pressure is on for a hotelier managing a wedding

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This week, the competition comes from Leamington Spa, where the first host, recruitment manager Debs, kick-starts the contest with a glam and boujee bash for her guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Second to host in Leamington Spa is hair and make-up student Charlie, who is aiming to spice up the night with a 90s girl band dress code, even if his own outfit might be too small

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Third to host in Leamington Spa is recruitment director Barry, who is hoping to elevate pub classics to new heights as he takes his guests on a retro-inspired night down the pub

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The penultimate host in Leamington Spa, Warwickshire, is publican Sis, who dons her hosting hat with a sports-inspired evening in a bid to wow her guests with some home-cooked favourites. Nikki gets the evening off to a rapturous start and regales her guests with green-fingered fables, but Debs is less than impressed by a lack of limelight. Relations are strained as the conversation switches to matters of cosmetic surgery, but the mood is lifted with a kickabout in the garden - with a surprising star player saving the day

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final host in Leamington Spa is lively administrative assistant Nikki, who's hoping that her musically themed menu will see her singing her way to the £1,000 prize. However, she puts her foot in it right from the start with publican Sis - likening her to a sloth. With tensions already running high with Debs, things take a turn for the awkward over mains when Nikki lets her real feelings out and things get heated around the table. Nikki cannot quite get her crowd going with her entertainment as she performs Man I Feel Like a Woman - even if it does get fellow ally Barry in the dancing mood

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Teacher Danuta is looking for a holiday home in Valencia city and has asked her close friend Rachel, who already lives there, to help her. Property expert Jean Johansson is tasked with the challenge of finding five options for Danuta's budget of £120,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman shows London-based Sri Lankan couple Kulan and Kamala five properties for their budget of £200,000 in Portugal's Algarve region. However, it remains to be seen which property has the most 'wow' factor to become the accountants' dream holiday home

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Three-legged labrador Dave seeks a new best friend, and his owners Laura and Paul hope that Luna, the beautiful but nervous saluki, will win Dave over. Nine-year-old stray westie called Norman gets much attention from mother and son Lorraine and Oliver - upsetting youngster Cynthia, a Staffie cross. Meanwhile, enthusiastic setter-poodle pup Obi might just win the chance to bring the joy and chaos that Mike and his partner Tracey don't yet know they need in their lives

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc: A crack team of Britain's top specialist trainers instructs beleaguered owners in dog management skills and dog psychology. Ferocious cockapoo Bear is driving a wedge between owners Paul and Louise. With their marriage under stress, Victoria and Adam must help tame Bear's aggressive behaviour before it's too late. Eleven-year-old Chihuahua Gina is a pocket rocket with an attitude problem. Because of her penchant for attacking other dogs, mum and son Cindy and Cory have to carry her around in a special zipped-up safety bag. It remains to be seen whether the trainers can teach an old dog new tricks

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: Actor David Morrissey, comedian Lucy Beaumont, diver and Olympic medallist Tom Daley and radio presenter and cancer survivor Adele Roberts take on three challenges set by judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith. They must attempt a savoury quiche Signature, a Technical teatime biscuit and a showstopping day off in cake form

programme.title: Jamie's £1 Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver shares recipes for homemade gnocchi in a cheesy bacon and pea sauce, aromatic vegetable noodle broth, and a giant Yorkshire pudding stuffed with roasted vegetables and crispy balls of stuffing. Plus, Chetna Makan shares a budget-busting recipe for yoghurt chicken curry, that can be made in a large batch for on-hand meals whenever you need them

programme.title: Tempting Fortune
programme.desc: The trekkers are now past the halfway point of their arduous journey, and fatigue is setting in. The chance to cut loose and enjoy themselves with a party in the woods and a silent disco may prove hard to resist

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: This episode focuses on a day at St George's during the global pandemic. Colin, 79, is rushed to the hospital after collapsing in his garage. Doctors are concerned that he has suffered a stroke, but he has also recently been diagnosed with a brain tumour. Tony is in minor injuries with crippling pain in his fingers. The 88-year-old reflects on his life, his love of dancing and how he believes the pandemic has brought out best in people

programme.title: Night Coppers
programme.desc: Afghanistan veteran PC Theo takes charge of a baby after its mother is arrested for being drunk. Meanwhile, ex-doorman PC Jack ends up in a scuffle, and newbie officer Amy is called to the aid of a vulnerable member of the public

programme.title: Derry Girls
programme.desc: The start of a new school term gets off to a bad start for Erin when she wakes to find her cousin reading her diary, but there is worse to come when Granda Joe announces a bomb has been found on the bridge. programme.title: Derry Girls

programme.title: Derry Girls

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: This edition focuses on North Yorkshire Police targeting crossborder criminals, with a fifth of theft and drug dealing committed by crooks from outside the area. programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: This edition focuses on officers cracking down on abuse, trafficking and exploitation In York, Sgt Mick leads early morning raids on two men suspected of exploiting and intimidating young teenage girls through the production of explicit images and videos, while Sgt Julian discovers seven illegal immigrants in the back of a lorry at Wetherby services recently arrived from the continent

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A scientist is overjoyed when his son follows in his footsteps, receiving widespread acclaim for a revolutionary new theory. When a fellow boffin produces evidence of plagiarism, the ruthless father resorts to murder to save his son from a scandal. But he reckons without the dishevelled detective, who sees through his efforts to make the killing look like the work of burglars. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, Jose Ferrer and Lew Ayres

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The owner of an American football team is found dead in a swimming pool, and his drowning is regarded as an accident. The down-at-heel detective is convinced that foul play was involved and sets out to prove his case - but his chief suspect has a cast-iron alibi that places him miles away from the scene of the crime. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk and Robert Culp

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A TV executive's assistant responds to being denied a promotion by killing her boss, then uses her years of experience working on detective shows to create the perfect cover-up. programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A terrorist posing as an Irish author heads a peace organization while secretly running guns for the IRA in Belfast. When he kills an arms dealer who tried to swindle him, the writer is sure he has covered his tracks - until Columbo shambles on to the scene. Detective drama, with Peter Falk, Clive Revill, Jeanette Nolan and Bernard Behrens

programme.title: Columbo

programme.title: Columbo

Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Ross Martin and Don Ameche

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: Time Limit (1957)
programme.desc: A soldier held as a POW during the Korean War confesses to having assisted the enemy during his imprisonment. His superior officers are determined to see him face a court martial as soon as possible, but the investigator assigned to the case suspects he is an innocent man incriminating himself to hide something. Korean War drama, with Richard Widmark and Richard Basehart

programme.title: The Big Catch (1967)
programme.desc: A group of children tries to capture a wild horse with the aim of selling it to mend an old boat. Children's drama, starring David Gallacher and Ronald Sinclair

programme.title: Life For Ruth (1962)
programme.desc: A doctor tries to have a man who refused to allow his dying daughter to be given a blood transfusion prosecuted for manslaughter. Drama, starring Patrick McGoohan and Michael Craig

programme.title: Sky Pirates (1976)
programme.desc: Two boys are befriended by an ex-pilot and his niece, who teach them how to fly radio-controlled planes. When crooks steal one of the aircraft in an attempt to smuggle a stolen diamond across the Channel, the children embark on an ingenious plan to thwart them using radio controlled Spitfires loaded with darts. Children's adventure, starring Adam Richens and Michael McVey

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours narrated by Dewyne Lindsay, this time exploring Canary Wharf and Southbank

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: First in a two-part special. The story picks up in August 1844, two years after Miss Matty lost her beloved sister Deborah. Mr Buxton has returned to live quietly in Cranford following the death of his wife, although Miss Matty is concerned about his relationship with his son as neither seem to be coping with their bereavement. The local busybody is also worried about Peggy Bell, who lives in an isolated cottage looking after her inattentive mother and domineering brother, so she hatches a plot to bring these young residents together. However, the surprise arrival of Lady Ludlow's son Lord Septimus leads to a chain of unexpected events concerning the looming railway, and a tragedy at Matty's own house forces her to re-evaluate her opinions on the subject. Judi Dench and Jonathan Pryce star

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered.

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Trudi confronts Richard about the thousands of pounds disappearing from his account every month, determined to uncover the truth. Katie is confused following her kiss with Jack and questions whether she can handle the constant temptation. Hari tries to get his relationship back on track when Siobhan suggests they could have a sexless marriage, while Jessica is struck by an unfamiliar feeling of jealousy. Sharon Small, Sarah Parish, Orla Brady and Shelley Conn star

programme.title: All the Right Noises (1971)
programme.desc: A married man and his younger lover keep secrets from each other - he conceals his family, while she hides the fact that she is only 15. Drama, starring Tom Bell and Judy Carne

programme.title: The Lovers! (1973)
programme.desc: A bank clerk and a secretary attempt to carry on a relationship - despite being the most mismatched couple imaginable. Romantic comedy, starring Richard Beckinsale and Paula Wilcox

programme.title: The Prisoner

programme.title: Pet Island
programme.desc: The documentary follows Martin and Jennifer as they travel to rural Co Donegal for a five-star luxury break for both them and their dogs. Meanwhile, the budgies compete in the All-Ireland final, and there is the story of how a Great Dane bonded with a three-year-old girl who has epilepsy

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the South Downs, starting from Beachy Head, and examines some of the 39 species of butterfly recorded as using its chalk downlands as a habitat, including the Adonis blue. He also visits the supposedly haunted yew woodland at Kingley Vale nature reserve in West Sussex and comes across peregrine falcons and badgers

programme.title: The Queen's Garden
programme.desc: Gardener Alan Titchmarsh is given exclusive access to the Buckingham Palace Garden in this two-part programme, as he visits the site over the course of a year, discovering hidden secrets as it changes across the seasons. He begins at the summer garden party where 8,000 people are invited on to the grounds, and meets beekeeper John Chapple as he harvests honey. He also explores the garden's origin, learning it was part of Henry VIII's hunting ground, and views the Rose Garden in late summer. As autumn arrives he watches the lawn being prepared for a special football match, and meets deputy gardens manager Claire Midgley-Adam as she battles to save a tree planted by the Queen's father George VI. He then helps royal florist Sharon Gaddes-Croasdale prepare the palace with holly and mistletoe at Christmas

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: First in a two-part special. The story picks up in August 1844, two years after Miss Matty lost her beloved sister Deborah. The local busybody is also worried about Peggy Bell, who lives in an isolated cottage looking after her inattentive mother and domineering brother, so she hatches a plot to bring these young residents together. programme.title: Hobson's Choice (1953)
programme.desc: A cantankerous, overbearing boot-maker spends most of his time drinking while his three daughters push themselves to the limit taking care of his shop and home. A timid employee marries one of the sisters, then sets himself up as a rival for his business. Comedy, starring John Mills and Charles Laughton

programme.title: John and Julie (1953)
programme.desc: Two children are desperate to watch the coronation of Elizabeth II firsthand, so run away from home and make their way to London. As they wander the city in search of the Queen, they have a series of adventures with an assortment of eccentric characters. Comedy, starring Colin Gibson, Lesley Dudley, Peter Sellers and Sid James

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: During an attempt to return to Earth, members of the team accidentally transport themselves to 14th-century Scotland. Sci-fi adventure, with Martin Landau and Isla Blair

programme.title: Pet Island
programme.desc: The documentary goes behind the scenes at the Saint Patrick's Day Dog Expo in Dublin, and meets Leslie Burban who keeps African pygmy hedgehogs in Cork. Plus, a look at the work of a cat midwife, following Shadow the Siamese feline through her birthing plan

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores Skomer Island, a seabird haven off the Pembrokeshire coast, and watches members of its puffin population returning from the sea with sand eels to feed their young. He also has a close encounter with the Skomer vole, which is not found anywhere else

programme.title: Jack & Sarah (1995)
programme.desc: A lawyer's life is turned upside down by his wife's death in childbirth, leaving him to pick up the pieces and raise their daughter with the help of an unconventional American nanny. This emotional romantic comedy strikes a fair balance between sentiment and slush. Richard E Grant, Samantha Mathis, Judi Dench and Ian McKellen are among the experienced cast

programme.title: Mysterious Creatures (2006)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, starring Timothy Spall and Brenda Blethyn as the parents of a woman with mental health difficulties. When their daughter's hostile behaviour and the authorities' lack of support become too much to handle, the couple decide to commit suicide together, writing a letter to a local newspaper to explain the reasons behind their actions. The cast also includes Rebekah Staton and Judy Flynn

programme.title: The Ashram (2018)
programme.desc: A man searching for his missing girlfriend stumbles on a secretive community in the Himalayas led by a guru with strange powers. He discovers that their mountain home may hold the secrets of reincarnation and a portal to another dimension. Fantasy mystery, with Sam Keeley and Melissa Leo

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: The events of Febtuary 25, 2009, when Turkish Airlines Flight 1951 went down less than a mile from the runway at Amsterdam Schiphol Airport, breaking into three pieces on impact and killing nine passengers and crew and all three pilots. A faulty radio altimeter was the initial catalyst in a chain of errors that led to the horrific crash. Here, survivors tell their story of escaping from the wreckage of what should have been a normal commute home to Amsterdam

programme.title: All Star Family Fortunes
programme.desc: Vernon Kay invites cast members from two soap families to play the classic game show in a bid to win up to £30,000 for a charity of their choice. Coronation Street's Bruce Jones (Les Battersby-Brown) teams up with screen wife Wendi Peters (Cilla), Andrew Whyment (lodger Kirk Sutherland), Samia Smith (Kirk's sister Maria) and Jayne Tunnicliffe (family friend Yana Lumb) to play for the Leukaemia Research Fund and the Leeds Upper GI Fund. Meanwhile, Emmerdale star Tony Audenshaw (Bob Hope) brings along his on-screen spouse Deena Payne (Viv), Verity Rushworth (stepdaughter Donna Windsor-Dingle), Alex Carter (son Jamie) and Adele Silva (Kelly Windsor), aiming to win big for the Variety Club of Great Britain and the Five Stars Scanner Appeal

programme.title: All Star Family Fortunes

programme.desc: Robert Llewellyn and Lisa Rogers present a Japanese-themed edition of the scrap-metal contraptions show. programme.title: EFL Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Liverpool v Cardiff City. Action from the 20212 final at Wembley Stadium. The Reds had defeated the likes of Stoke City, Chelsea and Manchester City to reach the final and went into the match as clear favourites in their first visit to the national stadium since it was rebuilt. However, the Bluebirds, who defeated Crystal Palace on penalties in the semi-finals, had been in good form in the Championship and will have fancied their chances of producing an upset
